results.headline: British PC Maker Raspberry Pi Soars in London Trading Debut
results.summary: British personal computer maker Raspberry Pi shares jumped on its first day as a public company, offering a boost to London’s struggling market for new stock listings.

results.headline: Malaysia Is Looking to AI to Get Its Mojo Back
results.summary: The country has ambitions in artificial intelligence. The trick will be sorting hype from substance.

results.authors: By Mackenzie Hawkins and Ian King
results.headline: US Weighs More Limits on China’s Access to Cutting-Edge Chips Needed for AI
results.summary: The Biden administration is considering further restrictions on China’s access to chip technology used for artificial intelligence, targeting new hardware that’s only now making its way into the market, people familiar with the matter said.

results.authors: By Jillian Deutsch and Ian King
results.headline: Intel Delays Israel Plant Work in Effort to Manage Global Costs
results.summary: Intel Corp. will delay construction on its $25 billion chip-manufacturing plant in Israel as the company works to pace its multi-billion-dollar investments in factories planned worldwide, people familiar with the matter said.

results.authors: By Lu Wang and Isabelle Lee
results.headline: Nvidia Eclipsing Apple Threatens Radical Redo of $67 Billion ETF
results.summary: One of the world’s biggest tech ETFs looks poised for a shake-up after Nvidia Corp. catapulted past Apple Inc. in size.

results.authors: By Erica Yokoyama and Yoshiaki Nohara
results.headline: Japan Affirms Primary Balance Surplus Goal for Next Fiscal Year
results.summary: Japan’s government reaffirmed its commitment to achieving a primary balance surplus next fiscal year in a draft of its economic and fiscal policy plan released Tuesday.

results.authors: By Joumanna Bercetche and Abeer Abu Omar
results.headline: UAE Minister Says US Concerns Over Chip Supplies to China Valid
results.summary: The United Arab Emirates believes US concerns about sensitive chip technology moving from the Middle East and into China are justified, according to a top official.

results.authors: By Youkyung Lee and Winnie Hsu
results.headline: Apple Supplier Stocks Drop as AI Event Seen Lacking Wow Factor
results.summary: A lukewarm response to Apple Inc.’s highly anticipated launch of new artificial intelligence features sank shares of some of the company’s key Asian suppliers.

results.authors: By Charlie Zhu, Kelly Li, and Jeanny Yu
results.headline: TSMC’s Premium Over SMIC Shows Challenges for China’s Chip Fund
results.summary: The share-price gap between Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and China’s biggest chipmaker is near its widest in almost two decades, highlighting the difficulty Beijing faces in building up its domestic chip industry.

results.headline: Chip Stocks Lose Shine as Hedge Funds Snap Up Software Instead
results.summary: Hedge funds made an about-face last week dumping semiconductor stocks — beneficiaries of the artificial intelligence boom — while snatching up software.
